caption: Table 2 - Limitations observed in the preview not documented in sources
rows: Design review and code review require manual file uploads and cannot fetch from VPC or internal file shares.
Only HTTP/HTTPS targets supported; tests against custom ports are not working and non-HTTP protocols are not supported
Risk of hallucinated vulnerabilities when additional exploit code is provided, potentially misattributing vulnerabilities.

Complex exploitation scenarios requiring custom tooling or local services are unsupported. The agent runs as is with limited built-in tooling available, and internal guardrails reduce fluency, preventing support for advanced attack scenarios.
Underlying language model and its updates are not exposed, affecting result reproducibility and determinism.

Agent does not have access to the runtime environment of the host under test (filesystem, OS, or application runtime), limiting analysis of file system-level permissions, ownership, temporary files, environment variables, and runtime memory inspection to detect cleartext storage in memory or analyze memory-based vulnerabilities.

Missing specific vulnerability testing capabilities - certain vulnerability types are not explicitly tested (e.g., CRLF injection, SameSite cookie attributes, HTTP request/response splitting, HTTP request/response smuggling, array index validation, argument delimiter injection, PHP remote file inclusion, window.opener vulnerability, browser cache security, log file content analysis, UI feature completeness, permissive allow lists, user management validation, J2EE bad practices, interpretation conflict, UI misrepresentation, external initialization, immutable parameter validation, GET method security, security through obscurity, channel accessible by non-endpoint, single-factor authentication, password system appropriateness, reverse DNS resolution reliance, weak password requirements, communication channel source/destination verification, missing integrity check support, error handling for missing/extra parameters, divide by zero, NULL pointer dereference).

Limited static code analysis functionality and scope - code review module and code scanner does not perform comprehensive analysis of all code quality patterns (e.g., variable/field modifiers, file storage locations, default permissions, ownership verification, resource leaks, proxy/intermediary functionality, link following, open redirect, symlink following, external control of system/configuration settings, obsolete function detection, function call with incorrectly specified arguments, empty password detection in configuration files, unchecked return value, generic exception throwing declarations, missing default case, omitted break statements) and does not perform comprehensive analysis of cryptographic implementation details via static code analysis (e.g., key management practices, key exchange without entity authentication, application-level cryptographic key expiration, missing cryptographic steps, encryption strength in application-level implementations, weak hash functions, salt usage and predictability, computational effort parameters, risky cryptographic primitive implementations).

No dependency vulnerability analysis - tool scans dependency manifest files (package.json, requirements.txt, pom.xml, go.mod, composer.json) for framework identification but does not check component versions against vulnerability databases (CVE scanning, SBOM generation, transitive dependency analysis, maintenance status checking).
